overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a methodical approach to time-series forecasting with limited data (96 hourly points). It identifies key patterns, evaluates multiple modeling options (SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing, naive methods), and selects a simple averaging technique due to data constraints. The solution prioritizes robustness over complexity, focusing on clear daily seasonality while acknowledging limitations like the inability to capture weekly patterns.
common_data_patterns: Load drops during daytime, rises at night
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) restricts complex modeling and weekly seasonality capture
Additive seasonality preferred due to stable amplitude across days
Simple methods (hourly averaging) favored over SARIMA/ETS for short datasets
Forecast generation via repeated daily patterns balances accuracy and simplicity
Data rounding (3 decimals) maintains consistency with input precision
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with thorough model evaluation, but ultimately implements simple solution due to data limitations. Includes detailed data pattern examination, method comparison, and step-by-step computation while avoiding over-parameterization.
